diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with delayed secondary sexual characteristics, bilateral non-palpable testes, ear anomalies, and other developmental issues. Key diagnostic findings included low serum concentrations of hormones indicative of both primary and secondary hypogonadism, a 46, XY karyotype, and genetic analysis showing an 8-nucleotide deletion in the CHD7 gene, confirming the diagnosis of CHARGE syndrome.
